section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 9. Diseases of the Circulatory System > a. Hypertension > 9) Hypertension, Uncontrolled

content.full_text: Uncontrolled hypertension may refer to untreated hypertension or hypertension not responding to current therapeutic regimen. In either case, assign the appropriate code from categories I10-I15, Hypertensive diseases. (Evidence: pg no: 52, L39-L41)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding uncontrolled hypertension whether untreated or treatment-resistant (Evidence: pg no: 52, L39-L41)
key_concepts: Uncontrolled hypertension definition (Evidence: pg no: 52, L39)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign appropriate code from categories I10-I15 for uncontrolled hypertension (Evidence: pg no: 52, L40-L41)
detailed_rules.explanation: Whether hypertension is untreated or not responding to therapy, it should be coded using standard hypertension categories I10-I15 (Evidence: pg no: 52, L39-L41)

usage_rules: Apply regardless of treatment status (Evidence: pg no: 52, L39-L41)
